intro: Tulista koelmaniorum, commonly known as the Koelmaniorum tulip, is a rare and striking plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces daisy-like inflorescences with bright yellow to orange petals. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a sought-after specimen for botanical gardens. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
